required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Superomedial Pedicle Versus Inferior Pedicle Techniques in Wise Pattern Reduction Mammaplasty :A Comparison Study
clinical_study.official_title: Superomedial Pedicle Versus Inferior Pedicle Techniques in Wise Pattern Reduction Mammaplasty :A Comparison Study

brief_summary.textblock: A comparison study between superomedial and Inferior pedicle techniques in wise pattern reduction mammaplasty

detailed_description.textblock: To compare complications of both techniques in wise pattern reduction mammaplasty and to correlate between complications and patient mediated factors

primary_outcome.measure: To compare complications of both techniques including nipple areola complex necrosis
primary_outcome.description: Complications include NAC necrosis and other minor complications including wound dehiscence and seroma or hematoma

secondary_outcome.measure: To correlate between complications and patient mediated factors
secondary_outcome.description: Patient mediated factors including age, BMI, preoperative hb, suprasternal notch to nipple distance

clinical_study.condition: To Compare Complications of Both Techniques in Wise Pattern Reduction Mammaplasty and to Correlate Between Complications and Patient Mediated Factors

arm_group.arm_group_label: Wise pattern reduction mammaplasty using Inferior pedicle
arm_group.description: Wise pattern reduction mammaplasty using Inferior pedicle

arm_group.arm_group_label: Wise pattern reduction mammaplasty using superomedial pedicle

intervention.arm_group_label: Wise pattern reduction mammaplasty using Inferior pedicle
Wise pattern reduction mammaplasty using superomedial pedicle
intervention.other_name: Superomedial pedicle versus Inferior pedicle techniques in wise pattern reduction mammaplasty

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous extensive breast surgery Breast cancer
